Dear Ms. Calcaterra:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 spit on and tried to fight Youth A during an incident that
occurred on 12/25/2024.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed over the phone on 02/10/2025
and had no additional information to provide.
Administrator 1 was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on
12/30/2025 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the
facility. He provided documentation and video related to the
incident. Administrator confirmed there was no incident report
written for this situation because the lack of physical interaction
between Youth A and Staff 1 did not rise to that level of
documentation. Administrator 1 also confirmed as of 12/27/2025
Youth A had been moved to a different unit where he would not
have contact with Staff 1.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/30/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He
recalled the incident that occurred on 12/24/2025, stating that it all
began with a verbal altercation with Staff 1. Youth A recalled
being in the hallway containing the youth’s bedrooms on the
unit. He was walking away from Staff 1 when Staff 1 came back
and approached him. Staff 1 got very close to Youth A’s chest
and Youth A believed Staff 1 spit in his face. Youth A stated this
may have been inadvertent because of how close Staff 1 was to
him and how Staff 1 was speaking to him. Youth A recalled trying
to move past Staff 1 so he could go to the nurse to receive his
medication, but Staff 1 stepped in his way and did not let
him. Youth A stated he went back towards his bedroom at the
end of the hallway, and he asked to speak with a supervisor. He
2

recalled speaking with Supervisor 1 about his concerns of Staff
1. Youth A believed Supervisor 1 listened to his concerns. He
confirmed he did not file a grievance as a result of the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
01/02/2025. Staff 1 believed his most direct interaction with Youth
A during the incident occurred in the hallway of the bedrooms for
the youth, after Youth A had received his medication and then
walked toward the end of the hallway towards his bedroom. At
that point, Youth A was yelling something towards Staff 1 and
Staff 1 followed Youth A. Staff 1 believed Staff 2 was right behind
him and would have witnessed the full interaction. Staff 1 recalled
Youth A being up near his chest as Youth A threatened him and
used verbally aggressive language. Staff 1 denied ever touching
Youth A. He also denied ever spitting on Youth A, intentionally or
unintentionally. Staff 1 recalled the verbal exchange lasting about
a minute or so and that Youth A walked away from him and
towards his bedroom on his own accord. Staff 1 recalled never
blocking Youth A from any direction of movement while he was
interacting with him.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
01/15/2025. He recalled being on shift with Staff 1 during the
incident in question. From what he recalled, Youth A had been in
an agitated mood for much of the day and this specific incident
occurred when Youth A walked back toward his bedroom after
receiving his medication. Staff 2 saw Staff 1 and Youth A
interacting in that hallway. Staff 2 did not see Staff 1 put his
hands on Youth A at any time. He also did not see Staff 2 spit on
Youth A as they interacted. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 did not block
Youth A’s body in any form, standing about a foot away from him
at the closest. Staff 2 recalled seeing the interaction end with
Youth A stating that he wanted to go to his room and Staff 1
walking away from Youth A at that time.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 01/15/2025. He reported not being involved in the interaction
contained within the allegations, but confirmed speaking with
Youth A later that evening about Youth A’s concerns. He recalled
Youth A being concerned that Staff 1 spit on him when they
interacted earlier, but also stating that it may have not been on
purpose. Supervisor 1 was told by Youth A that Staff 1 did not put
his hands on Youth A during the interaction.
Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 01/27/2025. Youth B
recalled witnessing the interaction between Youth A and Staff 1 on
3

the date in question. He was sitting nearest the entrance to the
hallway where Youth A had walked past him towards Youth A’s
bedroom with Staff 1 following. Youth B remembered hearing
Youth A get verbally escalated, but he did not know why this was
occurring. Youth B witnessed Staff 1 follow Youth A towards the
end of the hallway. Youth B did not believe Staff 1 made any
physical contact with Youth A. He did not recall seeing Staff 1 spit
on Youth A as they interacted.
Youth A’s mother was interviewed over the phone on
02/10/2025. She reported hearing about the incident later that
evening during a phone call with her son. She reported Youth A
told her Staff 1 hit him and spit directly on him. Youth A’s mother
stated she attempted to address this issue with management at
the facility immediately. She did not feel that was sufficient that
evening, but in the time that has past she reported speaking with
managers at the facility and stated that she was able to ask for
Youth A to be moved so Staff 1 would not have contact with Youth
A.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 12/25/2024 was
reviewed. Starting at 8:22:17pm Youth A could be seen
walking down the hallway containing youth bedrooms, and
Staff 1 followed. Staff 1 bumped his right shoulder on
Youth A as Youth A stopped walking. As this occurred
Staff 2 could be seen at the entrance of the hallway, a
distance away from Youth A and Staff 1. Youth A and Staff
1 spoke to each other for about 15 seconds with Staff 1
standing near Youth A. Staff 1’s hands were on his belt
area during that interaction. He then began to walk away
from Youth A to only turn back and stand near Youth A
again. Staff 1 then walked away from Youth A again, and
Youth A turned to walk to the end of the hallway. Staff 1
turned back around and approached Youth A as Youth A
walked away from him. Youth A continued to walk away
and Staff 1 turned back towards the entrance of the hallway
and walked away from Youth A a final time. As he was
walking away he could be seen turning back to state
something to Youth A, and then continued to walk out of
the hallway and out of frame. Staff 1 sat at a desk in the
main gathering area of the unit. About a minute later Youth
A had walked towards the entrance of the hallway and
began to speak with Staff 2. Both Youth A and Staff 2
walked down the hallway, speaking to each other. Youth A
turned towards his bedroom at the end of the hallway and
4

Staff 2 walked back. There were no points in the video
footage where it appeared Staff 1 made a spitting motion
towards Youth A, but this could not conclusively be seen.
Documentation reviewed:
• Training records for Staff 1 were provided and
reviewed. Staff 1 began employment on 02/20/2024 and
was up to date on facility de-escalation techniques through
their approved restraint model of CPI through his
orientation training.
• Facility policy titled “Intervention Standards and
Prohibitions” last dated 06/22/2022 was provided and
received. This policy and procedure was consistent with
prohibited acts as required in this licensing rule.
• Internal email communication from the facility regarding the
incident was provided. On 12/26/2024 Supervisor 1
documented a conversation with Youth A, Youth A’s mother
and a review of the incident. Youth A referred to feeling
unsafe and targeted by staff, but no other details were
noted. Supervisor 1 described conversation with Youth A
that focused on consequences of Youth A’s actions. It also
described contact with Youth A’s mother. Youth A’s mother
had stated to Supervisor 1 that she had concerns about his
treatment at the facility, and Supervisor 1 explained that
Youth A would be expected to follow the guidelines as
every other youth in the facility. Administrator 1 replied and
stated that he had spoken with Youth A’s mother the
following day. He described reviewing the video footage
and sharing his assessment with Youth A’s mother.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and video and other documentation reviewed Staff 1
did not spit on Youth A nor become physical with him during the
interaction.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
Technical assistance was provide that the facility focus on training
for all staff on proximity, non-verbal and paraverbal
communication. Staff 1’s physical behavior seen in the video
footage could be considered detrimental to effective compliance of
youth and their feeling of being respected while they are becoming
escalated.
CONSULTATION:
Consultation was provided that the facility that documentation of
review of alleged incidents to include details provided by youth of
5

their side of a story, as well as clarity in what information has been
provided by outside sources like family members of the youth
involved.
Conclusion VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to
a youth's background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff 1 used verbally abusive language towards Youth A during
the incident that occurred on 12/25/2024.
Investigation Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 on 12/30/2025
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth A
recalled the beginning of the incident where Staff 1 approached
Youth A in the hallway. He stated Staff 1 said “Fuck you” to him,
and also threatened him. Youth A could not recall what the
specific threat was, but he knew that he and Staff 1 both talked
about fighting each other. Youth A recalled Staff 1 stating “I am
going to fuck you up” and “Try something” to Youth A. He also
recalled Staff 1 making a comment about Youth A’s
mother. Specifically, Youth A believed he stated “You’re
miserable” to Staff 1 and Staff 1 stated “Your mother doesn’t think
so” in response. Youth A believed no one else would have heard
this exchange because everyone else was in the main gathering
area of the unit and he and Staff 1 were in the hallway.
Staff 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
01/02/2025. Staff 1 recalled Youth A struggling earlier that day,
and at the time of the beginning of the incident Youth A was
walking toward his bedroom at the end of the hallway. Staff 1
recalled Youth A repeatedly cussing in general at anyone. Youth A
6

was called out of the unit to receive his medication and as he did
he passed by Staff 1 and stated “roll your sleeves up”. Staff 1
believed he was referencing a possible fight between the two
individuals. Staff 1 stated back “not be so defiant” in
response. Youth A came back inside the unit and walked back
down the hallway towards his room, yelling something at Staff 1 in
the process. Staff 1 followed Youth A down the hallway, and he
believed Staff 2 was closely behind him. Staff 1 recalled Youth A
using escalated and verbally aggressive language towards Staff 1,
but he could not clearly recall what Youth A stated. Staff 1 was
not able to provide specific statements on what he said to Youth A
at that point in time. He denied ever threatening or stating
anything to Youth A about Youth A’s mother, recalling that her
name did not come up at all. Staff 1 stated facility training does
not allow staff to use curse words or verbally aggressive language
towards youth.
Staff 2 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker 1 on
01/15/2025. He recalled being on shift with Staff 1 on the date of
these allegations. Staff 2 recalled Youth A seemingly ignoring
normal protocols told to him by Staff 1 and in response stating
back to Staff 1 “Stop talking to me.” As both Youth A and Staff 1
were in the hallway Staff 2 heard Youth A using aggressive
language towards Staff 1. Staff 2 heard Staff 1 remark “Your
behavior has been unacceptable today, maybe you need to take
time in your room.” Staff 2 recalled stepping away at this point to
check on the other youth that were in the main room of the
unit. From the interaction he witnessed, Staff 2 never saw Staff 1
threaten or raise his voice at Youth A. Staff 2 recalled hearing
Staff 1 use swear words in his interaction with Youth A, and
believed this was half out of frustration and half quoting Youth A
back to him. He could not recall specifics on what Staff 1 said to
Youth A. Staff 2 denied hearing Staff 1 state “I am going to fuck
you up” to Youth A. Staff 2 heard Youth A’s mother come up in
the conversation, but stated that this specifically came from Youth
A who referred to his mother as an attorney who could take legal
action on his behalf in some form.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 01/15/2025. He confirmed he was not involved in the
incident itself, but spoke to Youth A later. Supervisor 1 could not
recall if Youth A stated anything about Staff 1’s statements or
language, other than Youth A expressing he believed Staff 1 was
too aggressive towards him as they interacted.
7

Youth B was interviewed over the phone on 01/27/2025. Youth B
recalled witnessing the incident in question as he was seated in
the main room of the unit nearest the entry door to the
hallway. Youth B heard the interaction between Youth A and Staff
1 as they were in the hallway. Youth B stated much of this
involved Youth A being verbally escalated and aggressive towards
Staff 1. At one point Youth A stated “You’re not going to fucking
touch me” to Staff 1 and Staff 1 stated “We don’t have to fucking
do this” in response to Youth A. Youth B believed Staff 1’s voice
was escalating as this occurred. Youth B recalled hearing Staff 1
use several swear words during the interaction. Youth B denied
hearing anything specific about Youth A’s mother other than Youth
A bringing her up.
Youth A’s mother was interviewed over the phone on
02/10/2025. She recalled hearing about the incident during a
phone call with Youth A later the same evening. Youth A’s mother
recalled Youth A stating that Staff 1 used swear words and
threatening language when interacting with Youth A during the
incident.
Video reviewed:
• Security camera footage dated 12/25/2024 was
reviewed. No audio was available with the video footage.
Documentation reviewed:
• Training records for Staff 1 were provided and
reviewed. Staff 1 began employment on 02/20/2024 and
was up to date on facility de-escalation techniques through
their approved restraint model of CPI through his
orientation training.
• Facility policy titled “Intervention Standards and
Prohibitions” last dated 06/22/2022 was provided and
received. This policy and procedure was consistent with
prohibited acts as required in this licensing rule.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed Staff 1 used derogatory
language during his interaction with Youth A.
Conclusion REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
SIR 2023C0000739SI dated 11/13/2023, CAP approved 12/6/2023

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
